Name: skdel2016
Title: One of the place of worship at Ujjain
Review: It,s Devi sthan near mahakaal parking at mahakaal pahari area. The temple has 24 pillers so known as 24 Khambha. It has ancient architecture. People go their for offering Pooja as well as tantra jaap. Jai maa kaali.

Name: Gdj
Title: Mata temple in ujjain
Review: Most famous mata temple in ujjain. Very old temple. On every navratri local govt administration do pooja there.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful Goddess temple
Review: This is a very beautiful Devi temple just near Sri Mahakaleshwar temple . Very nice ambience and good devotion on display

Name: Gdj
Title: Hindu mata temple
Review: Hindu mata temple near to mahakal temple.two devi murtis at there.there are 24 pillers on that temple.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A small but unique temple with 24 pillers
Review: As per name Chaubis (24)  Khamba ( mean pillers ) its a temple where 2 small temples located at entrance of the temple ( Mata temple ) and the whole premises stands on 24 pillers

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Religious place
Review: This was good but small temple. This was come in oldest temple of Ujjain. Chaubis khambha means twenty four pillars. Situated in centre of city.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the guardians
Review: The temple houses the gods, goddesses and the guardians of the city of ujjjain which has a extordinary froNt arch with artistic carvings.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Immense Tranquility
Review: I went to Chaubis Khamba Temple. The entrance showcases the images of guardian goddesses of the Temple - Mahalaya and Mahamaya with their names inscribed on the footsteps of the temple. This place is a must visit for the immense tranquility that it has to offer. It is great place to go.

Name: niya27
Title: In ujjain city
Review: This temple is near to Shri Mahakaleshwar temple. This temple is dedicated to two goddess - Shri Mahamaya and Shri Mahalaya.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: 1000 year old temple with 24 pillars
Review: this is one of the oldest temple in ujjain with 24 pillars dedicated to choti mata and badi mataNear the Northern side of the entrance are two small temples dedicated to Mahalaya and Mahamaya goddess.

Name: Jagadish S
Title: nothing much to see
Review: there are the ancient 24 pillars and a banyan tree. the temple has been created in the front which looks not a part of the pillars at all. on a busy street not far from the Mahakala temple

Name: yogindery
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple situated in heart of ujjain. temple dedicated to 'chotti mata' and 'badi mata', we some friends blessing morning aarti Chaubis Khamba Temple.Chaubis Khamba Temple between some pillars.

Name: Bhupendra
Title: Good sculpture but not the best
Review: You can find it at the enterance of the ram ghatThere are two temples at the outside while inside ones the original place is left without maintenance.

Name: perplexed_soul
Title: Soothing place
Review: It is a very old temple, dating back to the 9th or 10th century AD. As the name suggests this place is well known for 24 pillars. Worth a visit.

Name: rahulkumar1411
Title: chaubis khamba temple
Review: the speciality of this temple is that it made in 24 pillars with separate tomb.i like this holy place for peace of my mind.

Name: law_madhulika
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple is a captivating historical wonder dated back to the 9th or 10th century. The entrance showcases the images of guardian goddesses of the Temple - Mahalaya and Mahamaya with their names inscribed on the footsteps of the temple

Name: ankan146
Title: rarest architecture 24pillar temple in the world.
Review: very rare temple  , deities(mother) placed on either side of passage,, evening arti is a  devotees delight.. temple has 24 pillars..rarest. architecture.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Entrance to the Mahakalavana
Review: In olden times, Makakaleshwar temple was located in closed enclosure called Mahakalavana.. Chaubis Khamba was one of the four main entrance gates to this Mahakalavana. This two storied entrance supported by carved pillars on both sides was built during the Paramara period (11-12 CE) when the capital was shifted from Malwa to Ujjain. Remains of the old boundary wall can be seen nearby. Near the Northern side of the entrance are two small temples dedicated to Mahalaya and Mahamaya goddess.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Chaubis Khamba Temple on Chaubis Khamba actually
Review: Chaubis Khamba Temple is Actually on Chaubis Khamba. This is one of the very good and old architecture of Ujjain. If one is interested to see the old Architecture they must visit this temple.
